title: Tuesday Briefing: Trump’s New York Fraud Trial Begins
description: Plus a new release of India’s electronic music from the ’70s.

title: Spanish Nightclub Fire Investigators Work to Identify Victims
description: With only four of the bodies pulled from the charred remains of a nightclub complex near the Mediterranean Coast identified, the authorities are asking families for DNA samples.

title: UN Approves Kenya’s Mission to Stabilize Haiti
description: Kenyan security forces are expected to head to Haiti for a year to combat gang violence that has killed thousands.

title: Ethnic Serbs in Northern Kosovo Feel ‘Trapped’ by Politics
description: A deadly gunfight in a Kosovar village raised worries that the troubled Balkan region would be plunged into another conflict, with confusion and fear running high among residents. “I’d like to know who runs this place,” a mechanic said.

title: Alice Shalvi, Hailed as a Mother of Feminism in Israel, Dies at 96
description: She was an often defiant, galvanizing force in pressing for equal treatment for women in marriage, employment, education and more.

title: Tesla’s Sales Slip as It Readies Factories for New Models
description: Analysts expected a decline in sales for the quarter. Still, the dip may raise concerns about flagging demand.

title: Kenya’s Plan to Help Stabilize Haiti Goes to U.N. Security Council Vote
description: With hundreds killed, abducted and injured in a worsening cycle of gang violence in Haiti, Kenya has offered to lead a mission to help stabilize the country.

title: A New Satellite Outshines Some of the Brightest Stars in the Sky
description: Astronomers warn that BlueWalker 3, a test spacecraft with a large array of antennas, could be the first of many larger satellites in low-Earth orbit that interfere with astronomical observations.

title: Church Collapse in Mexico Kills at Least 10 During Baptism
description: A church roof collapsed in a city on Mexico’s Gulf Coast as dozens of parishioners were at Sunday Mass. Rescuers said at least three children were among the dead.

title: E.U. foreign ministers met for the first time outside the borders of the bloc.
Putin’s Next Target: U.S. Support for Ukraine, Officials Say
description: Russian spy agencies and new technologies could be used to push conspiracy theories, U.S. officials say.

title: India’s Early Electronic Music From the ’70s Is Finally Being Released
description: A trove of tapes discovered in a cupboard at the country’s National Institute of Design showcases artists composing early synth recordings on their own terms.

title: U.S. Aid for Ukraine Won’t Change, Officials in Moscow and Kyiv Say
description: Officials in Moscow and Kyiv played down the significance of a U.S. government spending bill that lacked new funding for Ukraine.

title: Nobel Prize Awarded to Covid Vaccine Pioneers
description: The physiology or medicine prize for Katalin Karikó and Drew Weissman recognized work that led to the development of vaccines that were administered to billions around the world.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: E.U. Foreign Ministers Meet in Kyiv for Summit
description: The top diplomats of E.U. member nations are gathering as the organization pledges to increase military support for Ukraine. Its most senior officials back Ukraine’s entry into the group.

title: Iraq Investigators Call for Officials to Be Fired After Wedding Hall Blaze
description: The fire that killed almost 120 people had been accidental, a report said, but occurred after a series of decisions that proved deadly.

title: Russia May Be Planning to Test a Nuclear-Powered Missile
description: Visual evidence from a remote base in the Arctic shows launch preparations mirroring those that preceded earlier tests.

title: Vatican Synod Puts Catholic Church’s Most Sensitive Issues on the Table
description: Pope Francis’ calls for open-minded discussion will be tested this week as bishops meet with lay people, including women, to debate topics such as married priests and the blessing of gay couples.

title: What Is a Synod in the Catholic Church? And Why Does This One Matter?
description: A seemingly obscure meeting could be the culmination of Francis’ papacy and lay the groundwork for lasting change on issues like married priests and the blessing of gay unions.

title: He Announces Baseball Games in Spanish. It is Not His First Language.
description: Bill Kulik, a Spanish-language radio broadcaster for the Philadelphia Phillies, mixes in English and Spanglish to the delight of some listeners, but the irritation of others.

title: Typhoon Koinu Moves Toward Taiwan
description: Forecasters in Taiwan expected Koinu, which formed over the weekend, to get stronger in the coming days.

title: Monday Briefing
description: An averted government shutdown.

title: Lise Meitner, the ‘Atomic Pioneer’ Who Never Won a Nobel Prize
description: Lise Meitner developed the theory of nuclear fission, the process that enabled the atomic bomb. But her identity — Jewish and a woman — barred her from sharing credit for the discovery, newly translated letters show.

title: Grizzly Bear Kills 2 People at Banff National Park in Canada
description: Park officials found the victims early Saturday morning, after receiving an alert from a satellite device hours earlier. A grizzly near the site displayed “aggressive behavior,” they said.
